description:
Leuven Meetup goes walking in the beautiful countryside around Leuven, followed by a dinner in a cosy restaurant in town.

The walk (10-15km) starts in Bierbeek (a village 10km southeast of Leuven) on the parking of CC De Borre and will lead along countryroads, next to fields and farmland. Following pictures give you an idea of the scenery you can expect:



Afterwards, we'll visit one of the many nice restaurants in Leuven. We should have dinner around 19h, so if you would like to only join for dinner it is also possible. Once I get a clear idea how many people will join, I'll book the restaurant.

How to get there ?

For those who would like to use the public transportation: Bus 8 goes directly to CC De Borre and departs from Leuven station at 12h32.

Also, I can take a few people in my car from Leuven to Bierbeek. If you're planning to come by car, and can take a few extra people, please let me know.

description:
After all the parties and New Year's drinks it is time for a more healthy activity. Let's go walking on the countryside around Leuven !

The walk will start at the Sportoase (on the Philipssite) at 13h30. We will walk past the Abbey to the War Cemetery in Heverlee... Through Heverleebos to the Zoete Waters where we can have a wafel/pancakes/coffee...

For those who are coming by public transportation, there are busses going directly from the station to the Philipssite. Buslines 284 and 285 stop actually right in front of the SportOase. There is a bus from the station to the Philipssite at 13h and one at 13h40.

Some pictures:




http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2409/2439656826_b0058dcc5d.jpg?v=0

Afterwards, we can take the bus from the Zoete Waters back to Leuven.

The walk will be about 9km and will take us through woods so appropriate walking shoes are recommended. To avoid that you will die from hunger or thirst (like some almost did last time ) it is not a bad idea to have your personal supply with you.

I hope to see you then !

Jan
name: Walking from Leuven to 'De Zoete Waters'

description:
Hi all,

Did you ever wonder how they make the famous Stella Artois beer ? Let's find out !

We're going to visit the Stella Brewery in Leuven and afterwards we'll take a draught course so we not only learn how the beer is made, but also how it should be 'used'


"The Stella Artois Draught Tour guides your company or club through the various stages of the brewing process in about an hour. After this tour you take an exclusive draught course in the brewery’s cosy Den Thuis bar. Every participant gets an original Draughtsman’s diploma from our professional Draughtsman. Of course, your group can enjoy their own self-poured Stella Artois and bar snacks. If you wish, you can also visit the Stella Artois Fan Shop, where you’ll find lots of original Stella Artois souvenirs. When you leave, you’ll also receive a gift to take home. The Stella Artois Draught Tour lasts about three hours."

Cost for this event is 20 Euro per person. The number of places is limited, so be fast to RSVP !

We'll meet in front of the station in Leuven; from there we'll walk to the brewery. Afterwards, we can have dinner in town.
name: Visit to the Stella Artois Brewery + Draught Course

If you only would like to come to the Museum or to the brunch, please let me know.

See you there !

There is direct bus connection (line 337), which leaves Leuven station at 13h04. We'll arrive at the Zoete Waters around 13h30.

For those who have a car and would like to go there directly, you can use this link to find out where it is. 

Should you have problems finding us, my mobile number is[masked]

What is there to see ?

Below you can find an impression of the area around the Zoete Waters ! There are ponds, woodland, and even vinyards !  

 

Where will we have dinner afterwards  ?

After a nice walk, we definitively have to go to a restaurant to compensate for all the lost calories ! 

We'll got to "Blue Blanc' - which is famous for it's steaks and hamburgers (http://www.bleublanc.be/)

description:
The Landcommandery of Alden Biesen in Bilzen is a completely renovated historical complex, built orignally by the German Teutonic knights, set between the orchards. We'll start our walk there, and those who are interested can visit the complex afterwards.  Some of it is freely accessible to the public, for other parts a small admission fee has to be paid.  Have a look at http://www.alden-biesen.be/enpaginas/index.php for more information.

Below you can find some pictures of the landscape around Alden Biesen

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Practical Details

We'll have to go there by car, so please let us know when you RSVP if you are coming by car and how many places you'll have available. 

We'll meet at the station in Leuven at 10h AM.  (Alden-Biesen is about 45min by car from Leuven). 

At lunch time we'll have a picknick underneath the fruit trees, so bring something nice for yourself (and for others if you want) !  In the evening we can have something to eat in a local restaurant or back in Leuven.  Depending on the dinner arrangements we can be back in Leuven between 18h - 20h.

The walk itself will be about 10-15km, so don't forget to wear proper walking shoes and a take a raincoat (just in case :) !!!  

(My phone number is 0476 /[masked])

See you there !!!

Jan

description:
Some more background information:

More than 100 historic buildings, rebuilt in their original condition, await you. Even the furniture, the farming tools and the household goods are authentic. However, the Open Air Museum lives. In Bokrijk, life takes its course; it follows nature’s rhythm. The morning sun pierces through the lush green foliage and conjures up a colourful light show on the Kempen square. The church bells ring and the windmill starts up slowly. The priest gets ready for a fire-and-brimstone sermon. And while the farmer and his wife warm themselves at the fire, the village constable patrols the village with a vigilant expression. The delicious scent of freshly baked bread at the local bakery delays the children on the way to school. Are you curious to see who will be required to wear the donkey’s ears by the strict teacher today?

 

More information : </a><a href="http://www1.limburg.be/bokrijk/eng/index.html" target="_blank">http://www.bokrijk.be/

Praktical Information

Entrance price:  10 Euro

We'll meet at 9h30 in front of the station, from where we will take a direct train to Bokrijk. The cheapest solution is to get a 'WeekendBiljet' which costs 9.60 Euro.

I suggest that we all take our sandwiches to have a picknick at lunch time. In the evening we can go to one of the many restaurants around to have a meal made with regional products. If the group is large enough, I'll book a resaurant.

If you would like to go by car, we'll meet around 11h at the entrance of the museum. The car park costs 3 EURO for a day. When you RSVP, please let us know if you can take others and how many places you have in available in your car.

Address: Domein Bokrijk - Bokrijklaan[masked] Genk. (Google Maps Link)

 

See you there !

Jan

(Mobile: 0476/[masked])
why:
There is a nice open air museum in Bokrijk where they have rebuilt more than 100 historic buildings (farms, churches...). Actors re-enact the life on the Belgian countryside of more than 100 years ago.

Definitively worth a visit !
how_to_find_us: We'll be in front of the station, next to the monument on the square
name: Visit to the Open Air Museum in Bokrijk

Hi all, I 'borrowed' this idea from the Leuven Couchsurfing group. As you can read below, there are no cars allowed in the centre of Leuven on sunday while there are many events organised throughout the city.

I'll be there together with the couchsurfers at 14h on the Ladeuzeplein (in front of the library underneath the beetle on a needle). If you want to meet us there, let me know by RSVP'ing.

Of course you can also just go into town, visit the events you like and / or meet us afterwards for a drink. (my tel: 0476/[masked])

Jan Message

 

from couchsurfing:

Truus Keulemans posted this message to: Leuven This Sunday (28/08) there are no cars allowed in the centre of the city. Because of that, there are lots of activities, who take place in the citycentre (cultural, sporting...)

Some of the things you can do that day are

- belly dancing

- backgammon on the street

- inline hockey

- visiting the city hall

- visiting for free M-museum

- free check-up of your bike

- AND many more... More info about that day and the activities you find on this link: http://www.leuven.be/...

I was thinking why not check it out together?!? It seems like interesting things to do on Sunday...

When we've had some fun checking it out, we could always go for a drink and a nice chat afterwards. Meeting details: Where? At the bug on Ladeuzeplein When? At 14h http://www.couchsurfi...

description:
Do you like bagpipes, highland games, whisky, folk dancing, celtic music, haggis, Scots and other Scottish things ? 

Then you should definitely join us on this trip ! Every year, a Scottish weekend is organized in Bilzen (50km east of Leuven) on the historical site of Alden Biesen.

http://img1.ulyn.net/142209_2.jpeghttp://www.schotsweekend.be/schotsweekend/(S(brgyom55gll1ii55lqcqxr55))/images/userfiles/image/foto2009/SW_RHCP%20live%20at%20the%20fruitmarket%202.JPG

Have a look at http://www.schotsweekend.be/ for more information. Tickets cost 14 Euro, but you can get them for 10 Euro through their website.

As it will be busy and I expect that the car parks will be quite full, we'll go by train. We'll take the train of 13h13 so we'll meet at the station in Leuven at 12h45. 

I hope to see many of Leuven-New-In-Towners for this event :-)

Jan

description:
I'll use the text from their website as I can't say it any better:

Beer lovers in Leuven will have the time of their life on the last weekend of April. Leuven will be bubbling as the City of Beer.
The Zythos Bierfestival is the largest beer-tasting festival in Europe. More than 100 Belgian brewers present 500 different types of beer. You will find a gigantic selection of Belgian beers in one place, Leuven's Brabanthal. Entrance is free. In exchange for a token of € 1.40 , you get your glass filled up with 15 cl at the stands.
Throughout the city there are beer tours, beer workshops, Leuven beer stories, tastings at Huisbrouwerij Domus and even the world's biggest brewer, Stella Artois brewery throws open its doors to the curious visitor. Don't miss 'Extra Muros' on the Oude Markt: the bars offer rare beers.

Have a look at:
http://www.zbf.be/index.php?lang=UK&page=1
http://www.leuven.be/en/beercapital/Activities/events/zythos-beer-festival/index.jsp

We'll meet at the entrance of the Brabanthal on Saturday at 19h to try as many nice beers as possible :-)

There will be extra busses going from the station to the Brabanthal (which is convenient as driving home afterwards is probably not a good idea :-))
http://www.leuven.be/en/beercapital/Activities/events/zythos-beer-festival/access-to-the-zythos-beer-festival.jsp
name: Leuven Beer Festival

group.name: The Leuven New In Town Meetup Group

description:
I've got following message from the event organizer. It sounds worth checking out. I'm definitely going :)
(we'll try to meet at the theater, my cell phone number is 0476/[masked])

Join us on Tuesday, May 21st for another great Brussels Comedy Night show with more great comedians and a crowd favourite returning for a visit.

Presented by: INTERNATIONALCOMEDIANS.com

Christian Schulte-Loh (Germany) visited us in February and raised the roof so much that we just can't get enough of him. He is a comedy superstar and has performed all over the world. He hosts his own one-man show at the Edinburgh Fringe festival. He is known as one of the foremost foreign comedians on the UK comedy circuit and headlines clubs across Europe regularly.

Soula Notos (GRE) - Born and raised in Holland in a Greek family. Crisis indeed! She knows it by heart. Growing up with shouting and gesturing relatives (small bodies, lots of movement), the only relief was comedy. And now, close to her well deserved pension, she loves to tell stories filled with self-mockery to as many people as possible. She has performed at the Free Fringe in Edinburgh, in Manchester, at the International Women’s Festival in Greece and many clubs and venues across Europe. "Great Energy. Completely original." - Funny's Funny Comedian of the Year 2011 Highly Commended Act.

Louis Zezeran (AUS) - runs clubs in Finland and organized the very first Stand Up Comedy shows in Estonia, using the cleverly named title “Comedy Estonia”. Louis has a like-able connection with the audience when he performs. He often talks to the audience, making jokes with the crowd and letting them become part of the action. Louis likes to make fun of cultural differences, and have a poke at everyone.

Stewart Johnson (USA) - has a knack for picking out the obvious yet hidden quirks in society and turning them into laughs you will never forget. He is an American who is based in Estonia, and has a more mainstream, non-offensive style, frequently drawing upon his experiences as a father. A witty, observational style that will tickle every single one of your funny bones.


Hosted by Joe Eagan(CAN)

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmay (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

When: Tues, May 21. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00

Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)
name: Brussels Comedy Night

description:
In the east of Belgium, in the region of Haspengouw (Hesbaye), the city of Borgloon is situated between orchards & vineyards. In harvest time, they organize a wine festival.

On Saturday Sept-14th, after awalk around the old city and a drink on a terras.. we'll go on a guided tour of a vineyard, between the braziers we'll listen to stories about the old County of Loon and we'll enjoy a snack and a glass of local wine.

 

http://www.borgloon.be/409277.img?width=300&height=300http://www.borgloon.be/471439.img?width=170&height=170

The cost of the tour is 7,50 Euro / person. I have to book in advance, so it's important that if you RSVP yes, you'll also show up. Otherwise the people who do show up might end up to pay a bit more.

We will need to organize a carpool from Leuven - when RSVP'ing, can you indicate if you could drive and how many people you could take ?

You may always mail or call me if you have questions (0476/[masked])

description:
Some of you might be interested in an event organized by Joy: they are visiting Dinant & Falaen. They go by bus so very convenient if you don't have a car. 

Have a look at following website for more information and to register for the trip: 
http://www.joytravel.eu/2013/10/29/culture-trip-visit-dinant-falaen/


(I won't be there myself, but you can contact Truus from Joy if you need more info: [masked])

Dinant is a charming town on the banks of the Meuse, the home of "Leffe" (yes, the beer), but also of Adolphe Sax (inventor of the saxophone), the 'Couque' of Dinant (a delicious pastry) and the Citadel.


Falaën (pronounced: Fala-un). A Condroze village with such a beautiful name must be looking also very beautiful. And it does, with castle farms, a picturesque church and castle ruins Montaigle, it is one of the most beautiful places in Wallonia.

What more do we need to say, come with us on this daytrip and discover these beautiful places of Belgium.


_____________________________________________________


Practical information:

Date: 16/11/2013

Time gathering: 8:00 am

Venue: Ladeuzeplein (square at the University Library)

Price: 35 euro (incl. transport by bus, visit village of Falaën, visit Maison de Leffe and visit Citadel with English guides)


Registration for this day trip:

 Transfer 35 euros with note “your name + Trip Dinant/Falaën” on bank account number BE[masked]

(BIC = KREDBEBB)

And email [masked] to confirm this bank transfer.

More information needed? 

Contact Joy Leuven ([masked])

description:
In the first part of our 2-part goat cheese event, we will visit a local goat farm and cheesemaking operation. This farmer runs a goat cooperative employing sustainable farming practices to produce some incredibly yummy cheese. He also runs a North-South program to introduce cheesemaking as a sustainable development project in African communities.

We will have the opportunity to see the farm (and the goats – hopefully lots of cute babies!) and learn about sustainable goat farming in Belgium, from the fields to the cheese room. There will be many opportunities to ask questions about the process and get a sneak peak (and perhaps taste) of the cheesemaking practices that we will do ourselves the following weekend.

The tour will last a few hours, and perhaps we can all go for a drink or something after.

The farm is in Alken, about an hour from Leuven. It is possible to take the train (and walk 2km) but if we can arrange carpools that will be better. Given the distance, we should leave Leuven at 14:00 to meet at the farm for 15:00. If you are able to provide transport, please post in the comments section.


*Update* - There is no cost associated with the farm tour. So this event will be free, except for the transportation to get to/from the farm!


We hope you can join us for a nice Sunday at the farm!
name: Goat Cheese Event - Part 1: The Farm

group.name: The Leuven New In Town Meetup Group

description:
For the second part of this event, we will host a cheesemaking workshop at our house in Leuven. We will go through the steps of making two types of goat cheese together – a chevre and a feta. The goal will be for everyone to learn a bit about the cheesemaking process, and to make some cheese of your own to take home at the end of the night!

We will provide all the necessary supplies (milk, cultures, rennet, cheese molds, cloth, cheese salt, etc.), and together we will go through all the steps you need know to repeat the process at home yourself. You will go home with a chevre and a feta, and the molds to make both of them again. Although we hope everyone will learn something, it is meant to be a fun event – nothing too serious! We will also provide some snacks to keep you going through the process. In order for everyone to be involved and have a chance to get hands-on with the cheese (and because our kitchen is only so large...) we will need to limit the group to 10 participants.


Cost: To cover the costs of the supplies, we will ask for a 5,00 euro donation per person.

Important: Everyone should bring 3 tupperwares and/or sealable plastic bags to bring the two cheeses and the feta brine home safely! Ziploc bags are fine for the cheese, but you will want a safe container to transport the 1-2 cups of liquid brine.

We hope this will be a fun event, and we look forward to seeing you there!

(We live inside the ring in Leuven; we will send our address by email)
name: Goat Cheese Event - Part 2: Home Cheesemaking Workshop

This year we'll meet up every 3rd Tuesday of the month to have a chat, to get to know new people, to meet some locals, to try some of the many nice Belgian beers on the menu or to play some boardgames... In a few words: to have a good time :) see you there ! Jan (0476/[masked])

Note that I have changed the start time to 20:30.
how_to_find_us: We'll have a piece of paper with us that says "Meetup"
name: Monthly Meetup: drinks, boardgames...
